description: From Middle English olden, probably originally an inflected form of old (compare Old English ealdum, inflected form of eald (“old”)), but later reanalysed as equivalent to old +‎ -en.

entries.meaning: From or relating to a previous era.

verbs.description: olden (third-person singular simple present oldens, present participle oldening, simple past and past participle oldened)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, old-fashioned or rare) To grow old; age; assume an older appearance or character; become affected by age.
